answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your daughter’s medical problems. The symptoms could be due to fibromyalgia, electrolyte imbalance, hormonal imbalance, Vit D or Vit B12 deficiency or peripheral neuropathy of diabetes and hypothyroidism. A pinched nerve can also be the cause. Lyme’s disease is another possibility. Please discuss this with your daughter’s specialist. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: On February 2  my perfectly healthy 6-year -old daughter had an episode she described a "her legs getting away from her" ;she  stood up and her legs  began moving on  their own. This happened twice. We took a brain scan and it came up clean. The following week she began experiencing  shocks running through he body, as it she were being electrocuted. Today  she suffered some kind of seizure, not an epileptic seizure, because  she  was fully aware if everything happening around her during the episode.  The doctors seem not to be able to find out what is wrong with her. Previous to the seizure she was diagnosed as having atypical migraines since the first episode described was accompanied  by headaches which have grown progressively worse.Can someone please hep me find out whats wrong with my daughter.
title: WHAT's ailing my daughter
